means: 皇帝的支持者，帝制拥护者

sentence.Network_en: They are ready to defend themselves against Uncle Sam's imperialist policies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们已做好抗击美国帝国主义政策的准备。

sentence.Network_en: The developed nations have all benefited from their imperialist exploitation.
sentence.Network_cn: 发达国家全都从他们的帝国主义剥削中获益。

sentence.Network_en: The play is being widely read as an allegory of imperialist conquest.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部剧被广泛解读为对帝国主义征服的讽喻。

entry.def: Imperialist means relating to or based on imperialism.

example.ex: The developed nations have all benefited from their imperialist exploitation.
example.tran: 发达国家全都从他们的帝国主义剥削中获益。

auth_sentence.content: They were "agents" of the imperialist enemy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They were "agents" of the imperialist enemy.

auth_sentence.content: For each vessel, the book listed an imperialist collector.
auth_sentence.res_content: For each vessel, the book listed an imperialist collector.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For each vessel, the book listed an imperialist collector.

auth_sentence.content: He had no political leanings himself, neither Republican nor imperialist.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had no political leanings himself, neither Republican nor imperialist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had no political leanings himself, neither Republican nor imperialist.

sentences.en: He continued to suppress the people and serve the imperialists.
sentences.cn: 他继续镇压人民,为帝国主义效劳。

sentences.en: That country is now freed from imperialist slavery.
sentences.cn: 那个国家现已从帝国主义的奴役下解放出来。

sentences.en: The famous anti-feudal and anti-imperialist May Fourth Movement broke out in Beijing in 1919.
sentences.cn: 著名的反帝反封建的五四运动于1919年在北京爆发。

sentences.en: The imperialists plundered many valuable works of art.
sentences.cn: 帝国主义列强掠夺了许多珍贵的艺术品。
